pcoI8IczXbQmACYKb_oa5Q.text: This place is amazing. Miguel and Adam were absolutely fantastic. The entire restaurant staff reminded me of In and Out Burger employees. Management has done an epic job with hiring and training. All were well spoken, polite and efficient. Not to mention the food was out of this world.

cA1pN29kVc4EUe7Bnkevdg.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome!!! The omelets are legit!!! Service is fantastic and food is incredible.... will definitely be back!!!

JzGZAr2op7DBQ33aO51K7g.text: Staff were great!!! Everybody take care of us... the food was great, it's was first huge omelette in my life , very big portions... we also took some to go!  Service awesome

arWiR-tiY8ueX5xVQOTc1g.text: This place has an old time feel with great food and service. They have a huge breakfast menu with 5 different kinds of Eggs Benedict. I have to say that the coffee is a little weak and even there double strength is weaker then what I consider a Normal strength.   I cannot say enough about the food and the service. It's my go to spot for breakfast.   My best advice is to get there early because it gets crowded quickly but even then there is not a long wait.   Some of the seating can seem crowded next to other tables so try to ask for a both.

fv5mC0d6dXUfGl58vrJ_vw.text: Almighty Omelet House.  I don't get many chances to go out for breakfast but when I do it's almost always Omelet House. Its like a fresh breath of grandma air when you come here..it's nice.   This OG spot has been in the biz since 1979 and for locals it's a cherished place. The charm of this place has to be its decor, Zagat says its 3.7 but no buddy it's 5. Every nook and cranny has some sort of Vegas history and/or vintage Knick knack. The family that operate this place are wonderful people that are often here helping out. The staff here are just kick ass, we always request to sit at the booth.. it's just tradition for us and they always try to accommodate us. Shirley is a sever there she is so witty and funny and Amanda is just the sweetest take care of them!!  The food is huge. Specifically the omelettes my man always orders the carnitas omelette, my go to usually is the lobster benedict also huge but the hollandaise and bites of lobster are so good you can't stop eating. Zucchini sticks are a must with the ranch & cheese sauces (((drools))) The coffee is also good, unlimited cups of joy. Most entrees include bread (banana, pumpkin or toast) and hella  chips of potato.  The only con is waiting, wait times here are no joke on weekends and holidays especially so be aware. During the week days isn't bad so I'd try to come than.   This isn't a chic glam brunch, and I'm so glad it isn't. You can put your phone down, enjoy your company and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Benedict, before I destroy it.
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our booth, this is the Louis Wiener Jr. celebrated booth.
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half zucchini stick order.

guU711bucGLVI8i3zKNGKg.text: Our cousin who lives in Las Vegas gave this his thumbs up when we were searching for a place for about 20 family members to get together for breakfast the day after a wedding.  I was scouting breakfast places for groups on Yelp and asking the cousin if he'd heard of any of them / been to any of them.  His ears perked up when I mentioned Omelet House.  He reported that it was a locals' favorite.  He took care of making a reservation for the group.  As we started to gather, those of us that were there early were sitting in the front hallway, watching lots of folks come in and get seated.  It was about 11:45 AM on a Friday morning.  The place was getting busy.  From the front you'd have no idea how large this place is - there are rooms beyond rooms beyond rooms to the inner sanctum.  The decor is very comfy cozy 70's kitschy.  Just go with it.  There's lots to look at, for sure!  Once enough of our group arrived to be seated, they led us through the maze of rooms to one large inner space.  We were about 22 by that point, and we weren't the only ones in the room.    Two servers were assigned to take care of our long extended table.  They were well-seasoned professionals and took great care of us.  Coffee refills flowed, and the order was gathered efficiently.  Often coffee shop java is just so-so.  Theirs was hot, fresh, smooth, and flavorful.  Great quantities of comfort food came forth from the kitchen in short order.  Though everyone in the family seemed to talking all at once, there was a lot of pausing to enjoy the yummy meals.  There were lots of smiles around the table and comments about how enjoyable the experience was for everyone.  If you're ready to go back into a time capsule of good eats and homey decor, this is a place for you.  Free parking / away from the crowds on the Strip or Downtown, with very fair prices and extremely large portions - it's all that!

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots to see.
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovingly curated decor.
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple, fluffy Belgian waffle.

Zysz53gtWAxYNpwu_g2jYw.text: Definitely one of the breakfast places you have to try. Food was very good, line out the door and very busy but worth the wait. I enjoyed the decor though while waiting in line, you know me and anything antiquey. Is that a word? Hmmm... Will have to look that up. Anywho (how about this one?), there's pictures of famous people who have dined here and items in a curio that's available for purchase. I fought the urge to buy something, good job me!   We ordered:   Chicken fried steak and eggs- you guys know this all I order if it's available and this has been the best I've ever had. My kids agree, they too order this all the time that my husband just rolls his eyes when we eat out.   Huevos rancheros- with hot sauce, my husband devoured his breakfast. We all did and believe me when I say that they're big portions.   Tip: come early, parking is limited.

Kh1-YfFgIxqlr8RhqoSPFg.text: OMG The Omelet House is out of this world. I ordered a Green Chili Verde Omelet which was phenomenal. I've never had an omelet so fluffy and the ratio of the ingredients inside was fantastic. The omelet was served with the most incredible homemade chips and the moistest, delicious, amazing banana bread ever. Wish I could rate more than 5 stars

e_kLeXruAKD80oLLDPwprA.text: Still got that bougie appetite after gambling all night & craving lobster somehow integrated into a breakfast item? Look no further! Their lobster omelette had the biggest chunks of lobster with cheese and eggs. The chef definitely didn't skimp on this one! What I love is that although they give you big portions, they also have an option to get a smaller size and 1$ off! Their potatoes are to DIE FOR. Cut thin some are crispy and others are softer, they have their potatoes attuned towards all potato lovers, crispy and mushy alike! Service was ok, but the food was where it was at. Also know that Clinton dined here, so you gotta know it's good! You'll LOB(ster) it!!!! I know I did. We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster omelette small plate (-$1)

elVHfWjYbb4nmkX4CzvnfQ.text: Omelet House rocks! Over 30 different and unique varieties on the menu, all with clever names, a gut-busting size, and crazy-low prices! Even the varieties with fancy fillings like asparagus and lobster are still around $11, and the sheer size makes them more than shareable. The three below are ones I remember but I always try something different.  THE SPARTACUS: Asparagus, mushrooms, and cheddar, with cheese sauce on the side. You wouldn't think to combine a classy veggie like asparagus with gas station nacho cheese, but it works! Even without a protein this packs a punch, if you can eat the whole thing, it'll fill you up all day. CHILI VERDE OMELET: pork, green chile sauce, and jack cheese. It's just slightly spicy, super meaty, and full of flavor. The green sauce is done well here, and you can add on various hot sauces at the table if you need extra heat. LIBERTY BELL: Basically a Philly cheese steak but with a blanket of eggs instead of a roll. No whiz or provolone, topped with melted Jack instead. Somehow it works, definitely on the heavier side but the meat is really juicy.   Omelets come with a bread choice and "Rip Taylor's favorite spuds", which are house-made potato chips, and they're pretty decent. Good mix of soggy and crisp potato slices to pick out the kind you prefer, but I wish they were seasoned better. Of your bread options, the Pumpkin Nut Bread is off the chain. Get it. Special shout out to the fried zucchini app, get it if you have a group to share with.  Service is usually pretty attentive, the whole staff hustles to flip tables and help each other out. Interior is bigger than the exterior suggests, and it's decorated country-style with homey knick-knacks and antique furniture,  back room can be reserved for especially large parties.

RTE6GStwOgU6_rcN2pDpmQ.text: Omelette House is absolutely one of my favorite diners in Las Vegas! It is not too far from the strip and it is a definite must for breakfast brunch or lunch.  Whatever you get make sure that you get the banana bread with your order.   The chicken fried steak is one of my favorite things to order. I get the potatoes medium so that they are not too crispy or too soft. I also get extra gravy for the potatoes.   Love love love this place!!

Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread

FDRlaDc7HPXzxhkoZ4ut5A.text: So glad we found this place on Yelp! It's located in a strip mall, and we were seated quickly for breakfast.   We ordered a Petunia Pig omelette and the Grandpa's biscuit and gravy. The portion sizes are HUGE! My favorite is the potatoes-they're like homemade potato chips. The server said they only serve the potatoes this way...that is fine with us!  Give this place a go! Two big thumbs up. Service was fast, staff attentive, place is clean. I didn't know hubby had a choice to get banana nut bread with his omelette-we know to get it next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This made us laugh! :)
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandpa&#39;s biscuit and gravy, Petunia pig omelette!

EyXmVEYws8Pybt125W-hUA.text: Family visiting from California, and decided to try this place out before we head back. It was an amazing experience from walking in to heading out. We were greeted, and Jose, our server, was super attentive, made sure we were constantly doing well, and overall got to know us. The food was another great plus! Big portions at an affordable cost. I would definitely recommend if you're on the fence about this place!

L4pTIDJtOoFgWZST0ev4Rw.text: Our server Kathy was an absolute gem. She made our experience very pleasant. She was attentive and definitely steered us towards the right direction with our order. Thanks. Kathy!   Had the split order of the "kitchen sink" omelette. Split order is an extra $1, and they give you extra "spuds" / potato chips. It came in two different plates. I would say, this combo is not for the faint of heart and the health conscious. This omelette was jammed/packed with all kinds of meats such as ham, sausage, bacon, plus chilli, cheese, onions, green peppers and a couple other things that I ate way too fast. The spud were surprisingly a really good side item with the perfect crunch.   Banana nut bread didnt disappoint. It's slightly sweet and savory. It comes with whipped veggie oil if you want to add a dash of saltiness. To me, the bread was good as it was. Nothing else was needed. It came moist and warm and I'm all for it!  Also tried the "fresh up" - which is a lot of orange and Sprite with a dash of nutmeg. At $3.20, I'm not that impressed. so, meh for me.   All in all, I'm glad I saw this in the episode of jerry seinfeld's Comedians in cars getting coffee. Otherwise. I wouldve not know of this place that is a few miles off the strip.  I highly recommend for an interesting breakfast experience.

Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Fresh up&#34; - orange and Sprite mix with nutmeg

60OynD0Ye7HenDfQV8o5zQ.text: The decor inside is pretty outdated but the service was on par. The omelettes are so big so if you are going with someone I would suggest sharing. Price is reasonable, and just about everything is substitutable. Overall they weren't the best breakfast place and there wasn't anything that really set them apart from other places and that's why I gave them a 4 star rating instead of 5.

VT_FvVuiWtrbYeTm4oD4zA.text: One of the many benefits of using Yelp when traveling is that you never have to figure out where to eat or what to do.  Just access Yelp and look at the reviews.  It helps you to avoid embarrassments like wandering into places called "Grandma's Kitchen" & finding out its a local biker bar.  Today's excursion was to find a place for breakfast and this place has good ratings.  Wandering in, i was pleased to see their food met my 2 criteria of delicious & lots.   These servings are large enough to be shared by two people!  I had their 38 special which has ham, sausage and bacon in the omelette.  It was great!  I couldn't finish it all.  They have their own parking but the photos in Yelp don't show this building is towards the back end of the lot and it's not the building off the main road.  Definitely will be going back!

gGKOSkwuHBr-sLenL5r05w.text: This is a great place. Coming from Chicago I've had some great omelettes and this is definitely among the best. Service was absolutely amazing. Very attentive to customers.  The banana nut bread fresh and hot. Then this big omelette is delicious from beginning to end. I will visit again.

3QDW8-5seZxhuKtOKa-d9g.text: Dude. Just no. I had the eggs Benedict and after one bite said nope. Ate a little egg off the top, paid and left. Husband had biscuits and gravy, same. We both have had awful vomit burps since I have even eaten rolaids and still have them. The hollandaise was low flavor, the English muffin untoasted and Unbuttered, thin shaved sandwich meat type ham, and their potato's were thin fried chips. Yes, potato chips. But the quality was bad.  I could have eaten it if it tasted good but it didn't. I'm so so sorry stomach.  Please don't punish me.  Waitress could have at least seemed sorry. Or comped a coffee or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What I couldn&#39;t eat (98%)

0YywEDIePPwUt5RFwo9x0g.text: 5 years ago... when my boyfriend and I took our first trip to Vegas together, we stumbled onto a little hole in the wall with some of the BIGGEST omlets ever!  They have almost ANY omlet you can imagine. He opts for the chicken, broccoli and cheese. Weird combo for an omlet, but super delicious. I went for the lobster omlet with avocado and cheese. Simple, but the chunks of lobster make it so savory and its gravy-free !! (Sidebar: I always wondered why most places feel compelled to smother their seafood omlets with gravy that reminds me of thickened clam chowder - yuck!)  All of the omlets are served with their version of home fried potatoes which resemble more like chips. They are also served with a bread of choice with your every day run of the mill options like white, wheat, english muffin and sour dough; but they also offer pumpkin and banana bread. I recommend the banana bread but the pumpkin is great as well. Those last 2 options come out like an appetizer... warmed with butter on the side. So delicious. We opted for one of each, but both fell for the banana bread even though the pumpkin was delicious as well.  Think what I love most about this place is in the 5 years between our last visit and this one is that the service ALWAYS comes with a smile. Even with organized confusion - this place gets SUPER busy at times - the hostesses and waitors/tresses appear to be happy to be there and happy to help with anything you may need.   After this trip, we will definitely make this the last stop on the way home with every Vegas trip. Hope they never change...

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, broccoli and cheese omlet with home fries... boyfriend swears its the best omlet on the menu
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster, avocado and cheese omlet with home fries. Delicious! And gravy-free!
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana and pumpkin bread... all hot and delicious... yum!!

gBXwYGWQMov4Rsp68gB1Mg.text: Probably the best thing about The Omelet House for me is the fact that serve their entire menu all day (or at least from 7am to 3 pm). I'm not a big fan of breakfast, so when I can order something like their Mushroom Burger, I am truly happy. We have eaten here several times, and everything we have ordered has been delicious! Hubby usually gets one of the Breakfast Specials--2 eggs, 2 slices bacon, potatoes, toast.  Our server kept our coffee cups and soda glasses full, and we never wanted for a thing! See you next time, Omelet House!

2f1CwNyA1JQeQCdcgdpU6w.text: Amazing food, from omelets, biscuits and gravy to the fresh banana and pumpkin bread. Portions were so large we couldn't begin to eat even 1/2 our meals. Our family took all leftovers to feed the hungry.  Thank you for the great experience definitely home cooking and environment

Vw2mgpArqc-3ZglUqmlVjA.text: Out with the mister and needed a little something in our tummies before we board and head home, the Omelette House was just the right thing. Great portions, good flavor, attentive service.   Pancakes, spuds, eggs, pork sausage patties all on point. My only wish was that we ordered omelettes,  afterall it is an Omelette House!

J8BTnvJm6rbUvSuBekMnpQ.text: Took my family for brunch today. The restaurant has tons of old school memorabilia on the walls everywhere kinda neat. Lots of pictures of entertainers from way back on the wall. I waited in line in what seemed like a forever wait but wasn't bad maybe 15-20 minutes. My Dad said I use to bring you here as a little girl but that was forever ago so I couldn't remember the food. My Dad mentioned he'd been here about a year ago. Not sure why I didn't get an invite but okay. So we sit down waitress came over we ordered drinks she was super nice! The menu is massive made it very hard stick with a choice. Everything sounded amazing! My girls order the normal that you can find anywhere pancakes, French toast, eggs and bacon. My Dad and stepmom ordered the meat lovers omelette and I had "The California Omelette " avocado, sausage and cheese. My Dad and I have toast and my stepmom had banana bread. The food comes out and the portions are insane! Loved the spuds neat twist on breakfast potatoes salty but yummy if you can deal with the salt. The omelette was okay I hate to say this but there was so much sausage it was too much. I never made it to even half of the omelette. The sourdough toast wasn't good which I really can't put my finger on it. When I asked my Dad he agreed. As we took out food to go the omelette opened up and there was all the avocado I was hoping for in the middle oh well. Not saying I will never go back but I won't rush back. I almost feel like I owe my family a brunch.

_zzDCc4UYcLEb6lI5kgeZA.text: Food OK service needs improvement my server took my order wrong and did not check until the end

WXZvuQkHcU2PfubTkyMY9A.text: Hi.  I grew up in Las Vegas and have eaten breakfast at the Omelet House many times.  My experiences have always been decent which is why I am completely disheartened by my family's last experience with the Omelet House.  Yesterday, my husband and our two children, ages 8 and 4, were running errands and decided to have breakfast there.  My husband had been fasting for blood work.  The facility was across the street and as anyone who has ever had to maneuver around Charleston and Rancho knows, it is quite difficult to get around due the no u-turn lanes and multiple lanes of traffic.  My family parked at the Omelet House and walked across the street at 9:50am.  He signed in at the blood place at 9:57am.  He returned at almost 10:25am ready to eat food and noticed that his car was missing.  The Omelet House had him towed.  Now I understand the need for ample customer parking on busy days, like weekend brunch, but it was Monday and there were many open parking spaces.  The gentleman and I use that term loosely, claimed that he waited 30 minutes to call the tow truck, but tow records show that they called at 9:52.  As my now stranded husband was trying to figure out what to do, The Omelet House staff read to him from a piece of paper something that ended in him needed to leave the premises with threat of arrest.  Did I mention he had two small children with him?  When did we stop treating people like people?  How would parking in the lot been any benefit to my family unless they were planning to eat at the Omelet House?  Well, if the purpose of the parking policy is to keep people from parking there, it worked.  I know of at least 4 people that will never park in the parking lot again.  Good job Omelet House!

6qkWL4G8yAkRfb0AK9EfQg.text: This was more filler food than anything. The "Joe" omelet I had was really bland. I had to dump lots of cholula sauce on it in order to taste anything. All was not lost though as the side of fresh potatoes chips was decent. Just had to dab it a few times with a napkin to get rid of the grease. If you're needing volume to refuel in the morning this is your place...but if you're more into tasty meals look elsewhere.

gV-9ee9fLLQDFDiKZdvXKg.text: I love getting their cowboy omelet it has chili and cheese on it.  Ooo Wee it's bomb.

yoxAXbjuSnz4bSvaCW2oMQ.text: Our first time here and our server Matthew was very helpful with suggestions. Omelets were excellent and the potato chips were awesome.

CsRuQsJiQ19BioC1XaDozA.text: I loved going into a restaraunt and being greeted with a "hi honey"!  The service was excellent and the food was down right home cooking!  Hearty food that mom always made!

dbFj2vR-5eaAOtS87T_QBw.text: Superb selection and great service. I only give 4 stars because we have only been there once and I want to leave room for improvement

srA3cbmpapy-mat-PSSs9w.text: As always.  Great food. Can share.  Had silver dollars pancakes.  Friend had a turkey burger with to die for chips.  Not the prettiest place from the outside but worth the trip

8M9K9gp1USDi0D4jqoYHXA.text: Potatos are amazing, a very solid breakfast choice. Bluberry infused french toast is ridiculously filling

mJjy82Ylb0XYOl1zJrke5A.text: Nothing extravigant...im a sucker for eggs benedict...but not when it has powdered hollandaise sauce!!

ylFCpattJf-d_S-iCpYpTg.text: Spent four nights in Vegas last week and had breakfast here twice. First time I ordered the comp banana bread and The Californian omelet (jack cheese, sausage, and avocado) - truly the best omelet i've ever had. So delish! Two days later I ordered the comp pumpkin bread and got the same omelet: it was THAT good! Both comp bread are excellent but the pumpkin bread is my favorite - served warm with a pat of butter - heavenly!! Also served with the omelet is a huge pile of homemade potato crisps...but omelet was so large that had only a few crisps, which were slightly salted and quite good. Definitely recommend this place!!

NAp6qEWHYeFzMQVt_7eNZw.text: This was the largest omelet I have ever tried to eat.  I was not successful.  The food was good and the staff attentive.  I ordered the potatoes crispy and the we're awesome.  Like thick cut homemade chips. My wife ordered a pancake.  And it was good.  She also was unable to finish the omelet.  I suggest if you are with someone, split the omelet.  It's great food.

iyumXiaYsF5CFAVn2yIQ7w.text: We have now added this to our must eat list while in Vegas! How can you go wrong with 38 choices of omelets and I think I could have sat there and ate the homemade banana nut bread until I popped a button. This is the only place that I have had an omelet and had the "stuffing" was throughout.  Our only disappointment was that we found this place on our last day in Vegas so didn't get a chance to eat there more than once.

RJoKaPkOTbTD3R9zQ4rb1A.text: I've dined at this restaurant multiple times and I must say the food comes to the table in a timely manner and overall service is great except this dark cloud I noticed approaching my table. She goes by the name of Old Lady Susan.. Mannn my heart dropped when I come to realize she was my server once again.. My past experience about a month prior to this date.. She made mistakes on my tables order and just had an old lady grouch to her demeanor. I didn't ask to change sections for a new server. I believe in giving second chances but yet another awful experience.. I must say this place is great when Old Lady Susan isn't around to bring in the dark clouds.

ILgNfkQeVuttdgdCUN0HjQ.text: How lame you can't do substitutions on omelets. A $10 omelet is now $13. Screw this crappy place, I won't be back!

ndsa3NTprT6xHlnrDZ0hNA.text: We randomly got on yelp to locate a reasonably priced restaurant before going to the strip where everything is expensive. Even when it's expensive, quality is compromise but not this place. We have to walk in and right after us a line formed and apparently the owner was busy trying to find seating for everyone and his hospitality was wonderful. He truly cared about us and every person that came through the door waiting for a seat. After waiting only a few minutes we were quickly seated and our second "wow" factor happened. The food as far as quality, taste, portion size was on speakable!! Everything was just wonderful!! Way above our expectations. The waitress was quick and very pleasant. The overall hospitality was impeccable. I highly recommend this place for breakfast and lunch. The prices are great for what you get. We are from Arizona and were visiting. We definitely will be back to visit this restaurant!

3VDmFtuZqrzy8DKorB-nRw.text: I found out about the place from an employee at Aria Casino.  Went there for the 1st time last week for brunch.  Amanda was our server.  She was personable and attentive.  I had the homemade corn beef hash.  It was delicious - you have to try it.  Everyone at our table enjoyed the potatoes, which were like thicker chips.  It had the right balance of seasoning.  The eggs were made to order, and were not over or undercooked.  The pancakes were delicious.  The 2 types of breads they served were warm and very tasty.  Next time, I want to starve myself and come back to try the lobster omelet.  The person who ordered it said it was huge and tasted very good.  They give you a lot of food.  It makes me hungry just writing this review.

qgNyGBKD6Y55VIwnyn3U-g.text: My new favorite breakfast spot in downtown vegas! Their corned beef is AWESOME and so is their banana bread.  I always want to try one of the omelets but i can't pass up corned beef so my review is based solely on the corned beef and banana bread.  Just thinking about it is making me hungry!

TV5oy9kjND8wUnlW9qaZig.text: Great local alternative to the over poplar Hash House chain. Must try!

XFo50ndQwet9XB2t6axgBA.text: An institution when it comes to breakfast. Been here three times now and one thing about their omelletes are the servings are big. We ended up splitting the ginourmous "kitchen sink". Which had everything. The taste was ok for me. Except they went all out on the beans. Part of our party enjoyed it and ordered it twice already.  It was like eating two omelletes. I tried their lobster benedict which is ok. The pumpkin bread was good. The mile high omellete I ordered was a little dry. Everyone elses food came out ok. The Belgian waffles are huge and so are their waffles. Most of their dishes come with spuds and we all enjoy them extra crispy. We ended up ordering an extra order coz it was that good. The only issue I have with them is that their drinks are overpriced. Regular coffee, tea, or soda is 2.75. Their pancakes have a hint of baking soda that we could tell. Overall the service is what makes them shine. They do take good care of you. It's that at home feel that makes this place a gem that we sometimes miss being around big business. I know they will stand the test of time since they have been here a long time. Whenever in Vegas this is one of our stops for breakfast.

Y4GZfKf6wi80OC00W0px2g.text: We start (and usually end) every trip to Vegas by coming to this location. My go-to is either the Californian or the Spartacus and my husband loves the Kitchen Sink. Don't waste your time on a side of toast or English muffin, take a chance and live a little by ordering the banana bread! You can thank me later!

ZYFx1uzgZyWUlstltzfz7Q.text: Still the best breakfast in town. Awesome service! Thanks Kevin for your gracious hospitality!!

4oB5QAQTRECe3503_9R94g.text: The layout and atmosphere are unique. The sheer size of the place prohibits self seating, as the server may never find you. We were greeted with the proverbial "we'll be right with you" from two different employees. Once seated, we waited again. Of course, I opted for the chicken fried steak and was met with some resistance when trying to substitute a pancake for my choice of bread. The eggs were cold, I'm sure due in part to the cold draft coming through the door we were seated next to.   The chicken fried steak itself was pretty good. Tender with a flaky breading covered with country gravy. However, it was served on top of what is usually fresh and crisp potato chip like, fried potatoes. I had to move the CFS to it's own plate for proper consumption.   The service was slow at first, but once they got rolling, the coffee and water were never empty.  I would give the chicken fried steak nearly four stars, but the overall rating is only three stars this time around. I will be back.

17QBrdAejFk3Tdmv8ryfGg.text: "Hands Down Best Omlettes!"  The Irish Omlettes is my favorite here and the pancakes that come with it of course are amazing! Orange juice a bit on the expensive side but then again that's almost every breakfast place! Anyways I'd eat here before I would at ihop or Denny's any day!

Y_n09vqEmBqdtb08RV5bzg.text: great atmosphere, great service and all delicious. Staff very frendly and the young boy was very attentive helping us with the menu. super satisfied

QsFRQdbKd6QZ_S11d4Kg2w.text: Great place to have breakfast. Enough staff, friendly, quick. Decently priced and close to the factory outlet center. We will be back.

DVc6D6ZAt9B25fF5F2BhAQ.text: This is a good spot for breakfast that's reasonably priced and gives you a lot of food for what you order. There's lot of breakfast choices, but the star of the show is the banana nut and pumpkin bread they give you before your meal. Also, the potato spuds are basically potato chips that are seasoned and ridiculously delicious. This place gets pretty busy, but the restaurant is also really big and seats lots of patrons at one time, so don't get discouraged by all the cars in the parking lot.

FZFxTOZbgghue1N49QStcQ.text: My husband and I were in Las Vegas celebrating our one year wedding anniversary and he loves trying new breakfast restaurants.  So we came across Omelet House it's hidden in a little shopping center with old memorabilia and a woodsy rustic feel.  They have so many options of omelets to choose from and the service was AH-MAZING! Our server was Amanda she never let our coffee or  water drop below half way.  This will definitely be one of our go to breakfast spots  when we visit Las Vegas!

-IZNh_RIXiJkgZRIynezdg.text: Very good find in Vegas off the strip. It was not busy as we came on a weekday. I had the porky pig baby omelet with spuds and toast. The omelet was delicious and while I was at first skeptical of the spuds, they were a great little addition. Will definitely be back!

Mw4ea0wEUu2xxIVNI1WU_Q.text: Just make sure you order the.......never mind. Order anything off the menu. It is all delicious. Even down to the simplest of things like their coffee.

6u2dnFtQy9rSOkpiNLAXWw.text: Great service! Very friendly staff and always refilling our coffee. The food was Excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

xtGwiJeuoRtv04JOeOZZvw.text: One of the greatest breakfast places in Las Vegas spots- this place has great food and great service!  I had the eggs benedict- delicious!   I will be back!

IvPE-D1cM-uYhyY6ah77-w.text: Nice old style deco. You can tell it's been here for a while. We were greeted and sat promptly. 5 of us. The omelets were huge and great. I ordered The Italian adding bacon it was awesome the kids ordered other omelets and they were amazing as well. The service was the best I have seen in many years just great.

4sXgbHRjoPt5eN7A9TaQgw.text: Party of 7. Service was fast. Every order was correct & service was perfect!  Food was delicious. A place to visit on your Vegas trip for sure!!  5

MUu71ee1a4y47YIxpjW3xQ.text: I'm retired and met another retired former coworker for breakfast at one of our favorite restaurants, the Omelet House. I've lived in Las Vegas 44 years and this is my favorite breakfast/lunch house. You have to try the Bugsy Siegel omelet that has marinated melt in your mouth beef chunks in a delicious Italian sauce, sour cream, and cheese. Their banana nut bread or pumpkin bread are a great substitute for toast. They have the best potatoes and I've never seen anywhere else. They are very thin sliced, fried and seasoned to perfection. Their baby omelets are 3 egg rather than their standard 6 egg omelet and I guarantee it is plenty to satisfy anyone's hunger at a discounted price.

I5MDTte6Kt5-UUbi5AD9VA.text: Be warned the omelets are 6 egg omelets, unless you order a baby, that's 3 eggs. Good portions, the spuds are house made potato chips, salty and delicious. Service was good and prices were very reasonable. Loved their lobster omelet. Will be back.

EeNxdV5x8ODIOhlXs_879Q.text: Superb service.  Everyone helps each other out there at taking care of the customer.  Huge portions too!

onVG4lTI3P6se_17xc4UyA.text: 3rd time here. We always come on a weekend after the gym. This place has amazing customer service and military friendly. Great replacement to our weekend trip to pancake house. Banana bread is crazy good!!!

gx4w2FKrfCmEZNngJ4EQxA.text: We were here a few mornings ago and it was the best! Their omeletes were delicious! I had the chorizo omelet (scrambled version) and it was the best! It was flavorful and had the slightest kick to it. All the servers were super nice and welcoming. The place it's self had a nice old charm feel. They had a ton of knick-knacks and autographs from famous persons who have eaten there! President Clinton had eaten there! Their potatoes were amazing! Great for a hangover cure. They were fast, even while being packed. Definitely give this place a try, you will not regret it! Wish we had came back the following morning.

_7CC0EWqEPHSTBkJhw4yuA.text: Had an omelet, of course. It was big and cheesy and delicious. Highly recommend the coffee and the banana bread too.

_pyPuI6oiCcdD_HSeKv1oA.text: The French toast we're not the same  and the bacon was greasy and small I  usually leave this place feeling very full  very dissatisfied after spending $50 but I guess I have to find another breakfast spot or even better eat at home it's healthier

WICqFlZh-luBFsWhLjXR3A.text: I ordered the mile-high city omelette and added tomatoes. It was excellent and huge! With the potatoes, you won't be able to finish everything. The atmosphere is interesting, very kitsch with lots of vintage ceramic figurines. The service was kind of slow but our server was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vVvb5vNBssvCiOm0jfnJdQ.text: This is my favorite non-chain breakfast spot and that's saying a lot because I would normally pick sleep over waking up for breakfast. It would take a lot for me to sacrifice an extra few hours of snoozing - this place is THAT special. I actually look forward to eating here...well, once every few months.  They have eggs benedict and a variety of omelets hence the name "Omelet House". Don't bother getting toast, make the right decision and pick the banana bread. It's delicious, warm, buttery and it's huge. It's like having dessert for breakfast - what a treat! My favorites are country club/ sparticus/ 38 special...in baby version which is still quite big (3 eggs). Your omelet will come with a side of potatoes. They're like thick freshly-made potato chips and oh-so good! You're off to a great morning and nothing can ruin your day.  Aside from omelets, they also have pancakes, waffles, sandwiches and burgers - I haven't tried them. With omelets served here, I don't need to try anything else. But I would imagine they're good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fave breakfast spot
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At 6:45am, parking lot is still empty since they don&#39;t open til 7am
Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x0ZpOK662FVFetCbwSH_-A.text: What a gem! This is a new must go to for me in Vegas. The food is delicious. I had the biscuits and gravy and it did not disappoint. Their crispy breakfast potatoes are to die for! Definitely make the trip off the strip to have breakfast here.

QKyiF4WBdEgpmGd40fBW5Q.text: This is probably THE BEST breakfast joint in the Las Vegas area. When in Vegas (twice a year) we always visit this place. Sometimes several times during our holiday. And I think we stand out being European tourist because on several occasions we've had a nice conversation with the owner asking us how we found and like the place.  We'll: we love it! The atmosphere is like you're dining with your crazy aunt that can't stop collection teapots and hasn't change her decor in ages. But that's the fun of it.. You'll find not only teapots, but also cookie jars, muts, salt and peppers, etc. Really nice to look at. And don't forgot the big wall painting.  Service is very, very prompt. Portions are beyond huge. Spuds are to die for. Best we've ever had.  Have to be honoust: although we come here 4-6 times a year we always take an omelet. Most of the times my love orders a 38. meat lovers omelet and I always order some kind of egg white omelet with vegetables and feta. Both a big succes. So can't really tell you something about the dishes besides the 40 somewhat omelet choices. But hey, why go to an omelet house to have a salad?  And remember Intold you the portions are huge. Consider ordering a baby omelet.

photos.caption: Photo of Omelet House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white omelet special with tomatoes instead of spuds. Delicious!!

KXW-YKBkKf-nVKW4AMYCkg.text: Walking into this place is much like going back in time. It almost feels wrong using a cell phone inside.  It has a farmhouse type of feel--but not in a modernized, trying-to-hard-to-be-farmhouse-type of way. Like, you know it looked like that long before it was cool to look like that.   The omelets are incredibly well-priced. They were pretty much all $11 for a 6 egg omelet (only 50 cents more for egg whites), unless you wanted a 3 egg omelet--then it's $1 less.  I got the My Little Chick-a-Dee Omelet, which had white chicken breast, onion, broccoli, and cheddar cheese. It was pretty tasty. Not the strongest of flavors, but nice and light.  My fiancee got the Rio Grande Surfer, which included chorizo sausage and cheddar cheese. I'm usually not a big chorizo fan, but this was really good quality.   Each omelet comes with their house made potato chips, which have an oddly appealing anti-crunch to them. Absolutely addicting, but when are potato chips NOT addicting? Nonetheless, I loved the unique spin they put on them.  The honest truth is you can't beat this place price-wise. My favorite omelets are at the Peppermill across town, but those are still 4 dollars more than this place (albeit, tastier). But if you want to support a cool little piece of off-the-strip history, go to the Omelet House and you won't be disappointed. Plus, the staff is really homey and friendly.

PkI-yG-txFTrpzlA0HFNtg.text: Great breakfast that is off strip, but worth the drive. Lots of various home made style foods to pick from and the banana nut bread is yum.

uJa4vLCADqlYIoZuNR-wlw.text: Delicious! The potatoes were great with my omelet! Serving was SO BIG I could NOT finish it, definitely worth the money and could get two meals out of it!  Only reason it's not 5 stars is because it wasn't anything... special or unique. It was missing that "WOW!" factor that would draw me back whenever I crave breakfast.  Pumpkin bread was also AMAZING! But I am not a fan of nuts, so I wasn't fond of that part..

QUNkkVSG2vKyofon1eYuCA.text: Whenever I go to Vegas that's the first breakfast stop. I've been enjoy thier cuisine for at least 20 years, right after they opened. 5 *****+

30mpyxXybNybm_VTfnd_gw.text: To day is Mothers Day , The restaurant was pretty busy  and The service was very good , I had Yelp them a few days ago . Food Looked Good in pics.  But now you can compare my pics Now ,to ones 9 months ago . Smaller portions more money. The corn beef hash was OK needed flavor in the corn beef plus as you can see compare pictures smaller portions but was OK with me because I really didn't like it. 3 STARS FOR GOOD SERVICE Price Too high $$$$
